constellations_other.name: Undercutting extremism with absurdity
constellations_other.description: Taika Waititi's satirical performance as Adolf Hitler in Jojo Rabbit connects to a number of other portrayals that includes ill-fated (and conceived) TV shows, memes, high camp and cinema classics.

results.title: Hitler's challenge
results.brief_description:
Episode number 2 of Series “History 1917-1967”.
Describes German re-armament, changes in foreign policy, the failure of appeasement, and initial successes of the Blitzkrieg. Presented by Brian Redhead.

results.title: Hitchcock at war: Aventure malgache. Bon voyage
results.creator_credit: Pheonix Films, Alfred Hitchcock, Angus MacPhail and J Orton
results.brief_description: Having just completed work on ‘Lifeboat’ in Hollywood, Hitchcock returned to the UK keen to contribute to the war effort. He made these two short films for the Ministry of Information, for use solely as propaganda tools for the French Resistance. ‘Bon Voyage’: might almost fit in as an episode for Hitchcock’s later TV series. A Scottish air gunner who has escaped from a POW camp in Germany and made it safely back to Britain, is being questioned by a Free French intelligence officer. As he explains how he was helped and guided by a Polish fellow-escapee, we watch (in flashback) the perilous last stages of his journey through France, passed from hand to hand by ambivalent strangers through a series of sinister rendez-vous that - he hopes - adds up to an underground Resistance network. ‘Aventure malgache’: Paris’ Moliere Players enact a thrilling tale of the French Resistance. The fact-based story concerns Claurousse, who boldly operated on behalf of the Underground in Nazi-occupied Madagascar. Sent to prison by the Vichy government, Claurousse is rescued by the British, and is thus able to continue tweaking Hitler’s nose. As in his previous ‘Murder’ and his later ‘Stage Fright’, Hitchcock seems delighted with the opportunity to combine the specialized world of the theater with the more treacherous terrain of intrigue. The film was made, as Hitchcock later told Francois Truffaut, to expound the inner conflicts which divided the Free French, and which had become apparent during script conferences. The most interesting aspect of ‘Aventure Malgache’ lies now in its typically Hitchcockian element of masquerade. In French with English subtitles.

results.title: Hitch hiker
results.creator_credit: Polly Turner, CPC Productions and Gerald Varney
results.brief_description: Young hitchhikers are interviewed and we hear their philosophy regarding hitchhiking. We hear their poetry, see them camping amid spectacular scenery and meet the people who are willing to pick them up. This activity is seen as a rebellion to parental authority and a statement of individualism.

results.title: Hit the ground running: making the leap from primary to secondary school
results.creator_credit: Robyn Holdsworth, Video Education Australia and Richard Leigh
results.brief_description: Research into the middle years of schooling has identified primary to secondary transition as a key period of risk in a young person’s education. A poor transition experience can manifest in a number of ways including truancy, behavioural and social problems, and disengagement from school. This video education kit builds on established practices for developing resiliency in young people. A range of specific strategies related to organisation, problem solving, conflict resolution and managing friendships are described and students are given the opportunity to practice these skills using a variety of scenarios. The video package is divided into four modules- 1. Secondary school: finding your way 2. problem solving 3. friends and pressure 4.conflict resolution. Comprehensive support material with suggested activities is also provided. Educational advisor, Marian Orr.

results.title: Hit and Miss/One Voice
results.creator_credit: Pip Karmel, Stephen Ramsey, Pamela Williams and Ron Saunders
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Breakthrough series”.
In “Hit and Miss” we meet Adam, dealing with the pressures of school and family. The resulting conflict is resolved in a constructive way. A teenager who decides to take part in an anti-logging protest is featured in “One Voice” Amber is ostracised by her peers, but supported by her parents. Watch her confidence increase as she pursues her beliefs undeterred by the attitudes of her peers.

results.title: Hit
results.creator_credit: Harry Korshak, Paramount Pictures and Sidney J. Furie
results.brief_description: A special ‘hit’ team, consisting of 7 individuals are recruited for a death defying mission of revenge. Each has their own motivation for blood lust. They are led by a vigilante federal agent Nick Allen, played by Billy Dee Williams, who is motivated by seeking revenge against drug dealers for the death of his daughter. The location is Marseilles as they close in on the drug syndicate. Also starring Richard Pryor, Paul Hampton and Gwen Welles.
